imdb_user_reviews.contents: As a South African, I can tell you  the entertaining, inspiring and enjoyable "Invictus" exceeded all my expectations.
Morgan Freeman shines in Clint Eastwood's solid drama
This is the greatest inspirational movie
A marvelous film to flash us back to South Africa's most precious historical moments...
Clunky, chunky, cliché... I had to turn it off
A superb movie about the power of personal character to influence a nation
An event that helped shape a nation
That film takes you by what you have most private, your soul
Sentimental But Never Sappy Sports Saga
Eastwood, Freeman and Damon equals BOREFEST
Turning Your Back on Terror and Torture
A great movie about individual and national greatness.
Rugby ended racism in South Africa?
Great work from Freeman and the story, but everything else feels average or amateur at best
Invictus Turns The Truly Inspiring Nelson Mandela Into A Platitude Mouthing Yoda-like Character.
From a Checkered Past, to World Cup Glory
Keep your friends close and your enemies closer.
Invictus  An Excellent Drama Based On A True Story
A Class Act on a Grand Scale
One of the best films of 2009.
Straight up with no frills, Eastwood-style
It is so much more thought provoking and politically aware than it may seem on the surface
Good and effective, great performances, but generally run-of-the-mill
One true story of Nelson Madela giving inspiration to his Country!
Finding  A positive way to bring people together
An emotional ride back to the past
One of the most moving films of the decade!
Wonderfully well acted by Morgan Freeman, and Matt Damon, and wonderfully well directed by Clint Eastwood.
Less is more!  Amazing, restrained directing by Eastwood!
A film about inspiration that genuinely inspires.
'Feel-good' race relations flick or extended rugby highlight reel? Take your pick!
Sport as a metaphor for life on the largest of stages
It's not about winning the game, it is about how you play it that really counts
Beautifully crafted film..Not enough to watch with two eyes
The Rainbow Nation starts here. Reconciliation starts here.
Inspiring. A country wishing for greatness.
I am the master of my fate: I am the captain of my soul.
Nelson Mandela, viewed from an oblique angle
Making the world a better place one rugby match at a time
Invictus succeeded in it's purpose completely.......
At the age of 79, Eastwood proves he is still a master filmmaker.
This movie is an experience - I will never forget it
Mandela got a deserved Nobel Prize so "Invictus" deserves an Oscar
Good Enough Sports Pic; Good Enough Political Bio-Pic
The Good, the Bad and the Rugby
Invictus...very good film for who knows something about South Africa
Freeman shines as Nelson Mandella leading a nation towards unity
This South Africa story kicks (u know what)!
Movie that is not for everyone to understand
One of the best movies of the year
An odd genre for Eastwood, but very glad he visited it!
A routine look at a legendary man at a critical time--it works by appreciating Mandela
Not much to say about such tame film-making.
Outstanding Film, High Standard entertainment, Clint Scores a try Here!
A shell of what this movie had the potential to become
A Solid Yet Unbearably Slow Drama
Appropriate timing for a great movie.
I'm not generally a fan of sports films, but...
One man to make a difference in a country torn by apartheid
I am the captain of my soul
Another quality film from Clint Eastwood
A Political Sports Film? Who Would Have Thought!
How a World Cup of Rugby united a country
Another Great human interest film from Eastwood
Conventional telling of an inspiring tale
Morgan freeman was born to play this role!!
much more enjoyable if you know The story
Moving portrayal of a great man and a great occasion...
As thee number one Clint Eastwood fan this one was good but not epically good like some make it out to be
Morgan Freeman must take all the accolades....!!!!! Magnificent Performance....
Screenplay results in totally off target absraction
Moved me to the very core of my soul!!  I loved it, as will you!
I Think He Wants Us to Win the World Cup
An inspirational masterpiece by Clint Eastwood
Outstanding film; one of the very best
I can't say anything bad about Clint. He's a living LEGEND! So let's all praise him whist he's alive.
Dripping in Good Intentions; Lacking Anything That Would Actually Make It Entertaining
This film will be nominated for some Oscars but won't win, fyi.
Solid Drama That Weaves on The Topics of Politics and Sports
College underdogs overcome the odds....without the padding
Invictus, a pretty enjoyable sports film.
You need more than rugby to bury Apartheid
A Storyline Hollywood Can Fall in Love With
Soccer is a child's games, Rugby is war.
once again Morgan Freeman proves he's greatness
Not exactly historically accurate. But it made for an engrossing and interesting watch.
Dull Ghandi meets Remember the Titans and Rudi
Apartheid's end meets the World Cup
A fine though hardly great sports drama, the Blu-ray version of "Invictus" comes with some spectacular extras.
Interesting and slightly inspiring but it could have been so much more
Interesting, but it could have been better
Clint Eastwoork and Morgan Freeman at their best.
A fumble from Eastwood, but this scrapes over the line.
A film that aims for an ambitious goal but skews the kick wide of the mark
That Rousing Second Half is Well Worth the Long Wait
Standard feel-good story infused with Oscar-caliber talents
Rugby ended racism in South Africa?
Great performances, but keep your remote in hand
Heavy-handed and awkward in places, but moving too
Political sports movie. What did you expect?
The Master of His Fate is given a decent, corny sports movie
It's much more than JUST rugby
Sports can create and/or strengthen unity
A One-Note Song or Short Story: Good Thoughts, Undeveloped Movie
Clint Eastwood's Invictus is a film of two halves.
Wonderfully acted and shot, if not exceedingly long and under edited
A film that shows how becoming inspired can change a nation when you connect up with forgiveness despite racial and political tension.
Invictus' action is caught in a scrum
Uninteresting unless you like rugby or are South African
In one line, a B-class potboiler that could have been brilliant if the Anti-American political message had been left out.
The Great White Hero again, Mandlela story needs the Great Tarzan

mc_user_reviews.text: An excellent movie, with excellent performances, both by Morgan Freeman and Matt Damon. I liked this movie, and I don't even like rugby. A good sports movie.

I think the acting in this movie from Morgan Freeman and Matt Damon really save this movie for me. It isn't a bad movie at all but it certainly could have been better. I don't have too much of a knowledge on the actual history (or rugby even) and I didn't feel like I finished the movie with much more than I started with, which is kind of disappointing.
Just reread William Ernest Henley's poem Invictus. Earnest indeed. It makes me think that the movie could just as well have been title Dickhead. I know that's unseemly but it does seem true.

This is a great movie! Anyone and I mean ANYONE who thinks that is not a powerful story about overcoming racial barriers are completely close minded. I am a white male in my middle age and this is the kind of thing we should be teaching our children! Learn from it, grow from it and for god sakes change your pov!

Confusingly and utterly dry and boring through most of the movie. Morgan Freeman does an excellent job as Nelson Mandela but Invictus fails to capture any passion or emotion at all feeling dead and boring the entire way through.

It's inspiring to see that having spent a life in prison, a noble, coloured person could rule with such dignity and respect for his captors.  This would be a great movie except for 1 major flaw; it's hard to believe that the escapee character played byTim Robbins in the prequel "The Shawshank Redemption" could become an international rugby player without attracting  the attention of the criminal authorities. And in the original movie, they fled to Mexico; not South Africa.

Un bel film, senza dubbio. Morgan Freeman e Matt Damon sono fantastici, specialmente il primo, che impersona Nelson Mandela come nessuno avrebbe saputo fare meglio. Leggermente noioso in alcuni frangenti.

Good film overall but the rugby sequences are piss poor. They actually manage to make Jonah Lomu look small (compared to his actual size) and the story is very Hollywood, and a bit far removed from what actually happened behind the scenes. However - the message of David vs Goliath is aptly portrayed in a good enough fashion.

Ultimately surrenders the depth and conflict of South African race relations to a sports game, which is disappointing given the performances by Matt Damon and Morgan Freeman, and the direction by Clint Eastwood.

Clint Eastwood dramatizes the true story of Nelson Mandela's unique method of uniting his country- through a South African team's victory in Rugby's World Cup. Brilliant performances by Matt Damon and Morgan Freeman, masterfully directed by Clint Eastwood. Superb.
A movie meant to inspire but has very little. While the performances were above par, the choppy editing and clumsy ending stop it from becoming emotionally gripping.

First off, this is a 9.75 out of 10. Near perfection. Story is remarkable. A great true story. Acting is Really good. Morgan Freeman is always good, and Matt Damon gives one of his best performances. I think they both got screwed. Seriously, Morgan had some competition, but honestly Matt had no competition. Score is also pretty good. Overall, this is a remarkable true story, and one of the best sports movie. Everyone should go, and watch this movie.

"Invictus" is a very overrated film. There's nothing special about Freeman's performance, and many scenes drag on and are ultimately pointless in the context of the story. Matt Damon is the lone bright spot, but even his performance could have been more furbished.

I had heard a lot of negativity about this one coming into my viewing of it from those close to me, so my expectations were quite tempered. Yet, I came away quite pleased. The film is as powerful and stirring as it should be given the subject matter and I thought that material was handled gracefully by the sure handed Clint Eastwood. Morgan Freeman and Matt Damon were both impeccable as Mandela and Pienaar, respectively. A film that shows that genius behind Mandela's pushing of success in the 1995 Rugby World Cup for South Africa and how he used it to unite a long divided nation, this one serves as a very good history lesson for those who are unfamiliar with the story and serves as great entertainment as well. Overall, Invictus is a very good historical sports film with fantastic performances that really make the film. You can really feel the tension throughout and it all culminates beautifully at the end. The only thing that makes this one better is that it's true. All-around good film.

Good, but could have been so much better. Morgan Freeman was shining as Nelson Mandela. Unfortunately, this performance was wasted on what turned into a typical, cliched sports movie. I understand that there was more to the story than the rugby team. But none of that emerged. It was simply mentioned while we watched Matt Damon and company go through the ups and downs of winning and losing games. The strong acting saves Invictus from being a huge and total disappointment.

Invictus is a movie about inspiration, leadership and overcoming adversity on so many levels. Matt Damon and Morgan Freeman played their parts excellently, even with the accents. The plot and script were both very well written. Even the 10 minute rugby scene had me on the edge of my seat.
A very endearing movie, and very moving. With the recent death of Nelson Mandela, it's nice to see a very accurate portrayal (by Mr. Freeman), and a feel-good movie about teamwork and country pride.
Invictus is invigorating.

Morgan Freeman  has been starring in Clint Eastwood in many films like(  Unforgiven , Million Dollar Baby)  and yet stars again in another  film  by clint eastwood. But in this film  Freeman is at the top his game in playing nelson mandela a role that he was born to play an order to  honor Mandela. All though i never thought that Eastwood's soccer film is not not over ratted its a crowd pleaser. the fact that it is based on a true story its touching ,epic , powerful. the acting is good , the cast is good whats not to like. Grade A+ ( KEEP MAKING GOOD FILMS CLINT !!!!!!!!!!!!!

This movie just shows how an entire nation can rally just from a sports team. Morgan Freeman did a superb job along with Matt Damon.  In my opinion, the rugby sequences were a bit dull, but other than that the movie is well done.

I personally enjoyed the movie, however at times this movie can be pretty slow-paced. You really only see like two matches in the movie but this movie isn't meant to be a sports drama, more like an inspiring drama.
i was looking for a good sport movie. this is not a sport movie at all, they should remove that tag. this is a bad history film about racism. never seen Freeman this dull (okey maybe in Wanted).

Invictus is what every rugby fan should be watching today, tomorrow, and the next day afterwards. Because no one is able to understand the truth of Invictus, this movie can be a pain to walk through at some point.
At its very essence a classically Hollywood, ultra-populist, inspirational underdog sports movie--and a well executed one at that.
The most boring film i've ever seen. Was supposed to be inspirational but it was just dull and it made no sense. Felt like it was far longer than it actually was.
